title: Cautious calm prevails around US court where Trump will appear
description: Journalists and law enforcement have gathered near the court in Miami but there were no signs of protesters.

title: ‘Extraordinarily difficult operation’: All eyes on Ukraine attack
description: Small territorial gains underscore the difficulty of the battle ahead for Ukrainian units with Russian troops dug in.

title: Colombian ELN ceasefire raises concerns over limits to violence
description: The agreement is a milestone for the Colombian government, though doubts remain over its ability to reduce violence.

title: Has Darfur become the main battleground of Sudan’s conflict?
description: Fighting in Sudan has led to a new wave of violence in Darfur, raising fears of further escalation.

title: Blinken hails US progress on China spying after Cuba revelations
description: US officials say China has for years operated spying facilities in Cuba that were upgraded in 2019.

title: UBS is wealth management behemoth after Credit Suisse takeover
description: As a result of biggest banking deal since 2008 crisis, UBS will oversee $5 trillion in assets, giving it lead position.

title: ‘Wedding or a funeral?’ Taliban bans music at Kabul wedding halls
description: The Taliban bans music at Kabul weddings halls because it is considered against the teachings of Islam.

title: Major US highway could take months to repair after collapse
description: Drivers face prolonged commutes after a section of one of the largest East Coast transportation routes buckled and fell.

title: Thailand’s PM frontrunner Pita faces election commission probe
description: Commission will investigate whether Pita was unfit to register as a candidate due to his ownership of media firm shares.

title: Sahara salt diggers struggle to maintain centuries-old trade
description: A trade passed on from generation to generation is now struggling to survive because of conflict and fluctuating income.

title: ‘Historic moment’: First climate action case goes on trial in US
description: Plaintiffs argue Montana's fossil fuel-reliant energy system violates their right to a clean and healthy environment.

title: Five things to expect from Trump’s appearance in Florida court
description: Trump's US federal court appearance in documents case likely echoing New York indictment, with possible key differences.

title: In Silvio Berlusconi’s words: Offensive quotes and gaffes
description: The Italian leader offended several world leaders, including Obama and Merkel, and often insulted marginalised groups.

title: JPMorgan to pay $290m to settle with Epstein victims
description: Agreement would compensate victims who say JPMorgan ignored warnings about Epstein's abuse and kept him as a client.

title: ‘Foreign-backed drive to remove Khan’: UK Pakistanis protest
description: Former Prime Minister Imran Khan's party organises a protest in London to show force ahead of Pakistan's October vote.

title: Why is the EU offering Tunisia a financial assistance package?
description: The EU hopes to stem the number of refugees departing for Europe from the country's coast during an economic crisis.

title: ‘Layers of vulnerability’: The children growing up in urban war
description: Much more needs to be done for the estimated one in six children worldwide who have to navigate war, Red Cross says.

title: Putin, Orban lead global tributes for Italy’s Silvio Berlusconi
description: Italian politicians, world leaders and sports figures remember the flamboyant figure, who has died at 86.

title: More than 40 killed in IDP camp attack in DR Congo’s Ituri
description: CODECO fighters blamed for the attack on camp housing internally displaced persons in Ituri province.

title: The Pentagon Papers, Julian Assange and the right to know
description: Media groups that publish secret government data worry their ability to cite public interest as a defence could be lost.

title: UNESCO chief says US plans to rejoin in July
description: US officials say decision is motivated by concerns that China is filling gap left by US in UNESCO policymaking.

title: Nigeria eurobonds rise after suspension of Central Bank governor
description: Godwin Emefiele arrested by state secret police at the weekend after his suspension by Nigeria's president.

title: Pakistan gets first shipment of Russian crude under discount deal
description: Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif calls arrival of the Russian crude a 'transformative day' for the crisis-ridden country.

title: Saudi Arabia, China’s tourists and Sino-Saudi relations
description: Tourism is a pillar of Saudi Vision 2030, and China ranks very high globally as a source of tourists.

title: Chechen forces sign contract with Russia after Wagner’s refusal
description: The move comes as the Kremlin attempts to control private armies fighting on its behalf in Ukraine.

title: The case for bottom-up AI
description: With an open source approach, AI can help us build a more inclusive, innovative, and democratic society.

title: Saudi Arabia signs $5.6bn EV deal as it eyes closer China ties
description: Riyadh leads the Arab region in boosting trade ties with Beijing as it looks to diversify its economy away from oil.

title: Mother’s last words after Colombia plane crash: ‘Get out of here’
description: Four children survive 40 days in the Amazon jungle on their own after their mother dies of her injuries.

title: Mass fish deaths on Texas Gulf Coast due to low oxygen
description: Officials said the species most impacted by this fish kill was the Gulf menhaden.

title: Iraq approves record $153bn budget aimed at creating jobs
description: Iraq passes its largest budget till date aimed at creating public sector jobs and build war-damaged infrastructure.

title: Six officers face trial in Switzerland for Nigerian man’s death
description: A 'homicide by neglect' trial opens in Lausanne over the 2018 death of Mike Ben Peter during his arrest.

title: Plastic waste turned into rugs in rebel-held Syria
description: Recycled plastic is transformed into floor rugs and other items in the impoverished rebel-held Syria.

title: Italy’s Berlusconi, ‘the knight’ known for scandals, dies at 86
description: The tycoon, four-time Italian prime minister, and master of controversy was rarely out of the headlines.

title: Southern Iraq’s toxic skies are a colonial legacy
description: The chain of events that led to the poisoning of Iraq’s skies by international oil companies started over a century ago.

title: Italy’s Silvio Berlusconi dies after several bouts of illness
description: The billionaire businessman transformed Italy's political landscape, often while fending off legal and sex scandals.

title: High alert as Cyclone Biparjoy approaches India, Pakistan coasts
description: The severe cyclonic storm is likely to hit India's west coast and southern Pakistan later this week.

title: In India’s riot-hit Manipur, Muslims stuck between warring groups
description: Meitei Pangals, as the community is known in Manipur, have been caught in the ethnic crossfire for more than a month.

title: Fuel subsidy cut will save Nigeria but impose burden: President
description: The subsidy removal has angered labour unions but they have suspended an indefinite strike after talks with government.

title: No progress on biases against women in a decade: UN report
description: Biased social norms and COVID-19, when many women lost their income, have stalled progress on inequality, UN says.

title: China, other states, fortify nuclear weapons arsenals: Report
description: Think tank says China had 17 percent more nuclear warheads in January 2023 compared with the year before.

title: Iran’s Raisi after ‘strategic’ ties in South America tour
description: Iran has said standing up to Western imperialism is a main message of the president's tour.

title: Can humans stop ageing?
description: As researchers continue to examine the causes of ageing, some seek ways to stop it altogether.

title: George Soros to pass control of his empire to son Alexander
description: Multibillionaire funder of democratic and liberal causes says 37-year-old has 'earned' job at helm of $25b empire.

title: Why are thousands of Reddit pages going dark for 48 hours?
description: From June 12 to June 14, thousands of Reddit communities are going offline to protest planned API pricing changes.

title: Lava seen at Philippines’s Mayon volcano as thousands evacuate
description: At least 12,800 people have been evacuated from the area around the mountain as volcanic activity intensifies.

title: Ten killed in wedding party bus crash in Australia
description: Chartered bus was thought to be carrying guests from a wedding reception at a wine estate back to their accommodation.

title: Australia confronts ‘war hero’ myth after Ben Roberts-Smith case
description: Veneration of veterans gained momentum in the John Howard era and the revelations from Afghanistan have shocked many.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 474
description: As the war enters its 474th day, these are the main developments.
